data.title: Johnson Funeral Home & Crematory
data.meta_description:
Mitchell J. Rosol, age 34 of Clarksville, IA passed away on Wednesday, June 3, 2015 at his home.

Services will be held at 10:30 AM on Tuesday, June 9, 2015 at the United Methodist Church in Nashua, IA with Pastor Alfredo Agtarap officiating. 

Visitation will be held from 4:00-8:00 PM Monday, June 8, 2015 at Conway-Markham Funeral Home in Nashua, Iowa. Visitation will continue at the church one hour prior to the funeral on Tuesday. Online condolences for Mitch's family may be left at www.conway-markhamfh.com. Memorials may be directed to the family. 

Mitchell John Rosol was born on October 21, 1980, in New Hampton, IA, the son of David and Rhonda (Fisher) Rosol. He attended Nashua-Plainfield High School. Following high school Mitch went to work for Bay Valley Foods in New Hampton following Bay Valley Foods he went to work at Red Line Vending in New Hampton, where he worked for several years. On July 18, 2006 Mitch was united in marriage to Tami Wilharm to this union two children were born, Rylee and Hailee. The couple later went their separate ways.

Mitch lived simply, but he had a strong passion for three things in life, his two daughters and the outdoors. In his free time if it was in season Mitch was hunting it, and if the fish were biting he was fishing for it. Right beside him you would often find his two best friends Rylee and Hailee during his outdoor adventures.

Left to honor his memory are his children, Rylee, Hailee Rosol, their mother Tami of Nashua; parents, David and Rhonda Rosol of Nashua; sisters, Charity Ellifritz, her children Cadence and Tyler of Nashua, Lindsey (Tim) Eisenmenger, their child Sophie of Nashua; brother, Dustin (KC Mishak) Rosol, his child Maddison of Alta Vista; and many more loving family and friends.

Mitch is preceded in death by his grandparents, special cousin Kirk Ackerson, half-brother Johnathan Goddard.
